bill_title: revise the residency requirements for voting purposes and to revise the criteria for determining if any person has voted more than once at any election.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the residency requirements for voting purposes. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 12-1-4 be amended to read as follows: 12-1-4. For the purposes of this title, the term, residence, means the place in which a person has fixed his or her habitation and to which the person, whenever absent, intends to return. A person who has left home and gone into another state or territory or county of this state for a temporary purpose only has not changed his or her residence. A person is considered to have gained a residence in any county or municipality of this state in which the person actually lives, if the person has no present intention of leaving and has actually resided in South Dakota for at least thirty consecutive days . If a person moves to another state, or to any of the other territories, with the intention of making it his or her permanent home, the person thereby loses residence in this state. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the residency requirements for voting purposes and to revise certain penalties for voting more than once at any election. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 12-1-4 be amended to read as follows: 12-1-4. For the purposes of this title, the term, residence, means the place in which a person has fixed his or her habitation and to which the person, whenever absent, intends to return. A person who has left home and gone into another state or territory or county of this state for a temporary purpose only has not changed his or her residence. A person is considered to have gained a residence in any county or municipality of this state in which the person actually lives, if the person has no present intention of leaving and has actually resided in South Dakota for at least thirty consecutive days . If a person moves to another state, or to any of the other territories, with the intention of making it his or her permanent home, the person thereby loses residence in this state. Section 2. That § 12-26-8 be amended to read as follows: 12-26-8. A person who votes more than once at any election or who offers to vote after having once voted, either in the same or in another election precinct in South Dakota or elsewhere , is guilty of a Class 1 misdemeanor Class 5 felony .

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the residency requirements for voting purposes and to revise the criteria for determining if any person has voted more than once at any election. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 12-1-4 be amended to read as follows: 12-1-4. For the purposes of this title, the term, residence, means the place in which a person has fixed his or her habitation and to which the person, whenever absent, intends to return. A person who has left home and gone into another state or territory or county of this state for a temporary purpose only has not changed his or her residence. A person is considered to have gained a residence in any county or municipality of this state in which the person actually lives, if the person has no present intention of leaving and has actually resided in South Dakota for at least thirty consecutive days . If a person moves to another state, or to any of the other territories, with the intention of making it his or her permanent home, the person thereby loses residence in this state. Section 2. That § 12-26-8 be amended to read as follows: 12-26-8. A person who votes more than once at any election or who offers to vote after having once voted, either in the same or in another election precinct in South Dakota or elsewhere , is guilty of a Class 1 misdemeanor.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the residency requirements for voting purposes and to revise the criteria for determining if any person has voted more than once at any election. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 12-1-4 be amended to read as follows: 12-1-4. For the purposes of this title, the term, residence, means the place in which a person has fixed his or her habitation and to which the person, whenever absent, intends to return. A person is considered to have gained a residence in any county or municipality of this state in which the person actually lives, if the person has no present intention of leaving and has actually resided in South Dakota for at least thirty consecutive days . If a person moves to another state, or to any of the other territories, with the intention of making it his or her permanent home, the person thereby loses residence in this state. Section 2. That § 12-26-8 be amended to read as follows: 12-26-8. A person who votes more than once at any election or who offers to vote after having once voted, either in the same or in another election precinct in South Dakota or elsewhere , is guilty of a Class 1 misdemeanor Class 6 felony .
